title: West Ham boss Manuel Pellegrini slams his players after falling to 2-0 defeat at Everton
text:
West Ham manager Manuel Pellegrini laid into his players after a dismal defeat at Everton which left his side just points ahead of their hosts, who had started the weekend in the bottom three.

After a bright start to the season, West Ham are wobbling after two consecutive losses, and they were flattered by only losing 2-0 at Goodison Park.

The Hammers beat Manchester United 2-0 but are yet to win a game since, and Pellegrini did not hold back in his criticism of the players - saying he would have changed the entire team at the interval given the opportunity.

West Ham boss Manuel Pellegrini was scathing of his players as they struggled to a 2-0 loss

Pellegrini said: ‘Without any doubt, I am not happy. Before the game we knew all about Everton being tough at home and their position in the table was going to make it doubly difficult.

‘I know Aaron Cresswell (left-back) was not 100 per cent able to play but I don’ t must missing one player was a problem.

‘We didn’t have a shot in the first half and Everton could have scored more. I chose to take off Felipe Anderson at half-time but if I’d been able to change 11 at that moment, I might have done.

The Hammers were poor against the Toffees and failed to register a shot in the first half

Manuel Pellegrini has stabilised the club after succeeding David Moyes at the London Stadium

‘We were a little better in the second half and had some chances but we need to be clear we have to improve to become the same team we were a couple of weeks ago.’

£25million Spaniard Pablo Fornals continued his struggle after a summer move from Villarreal and was taken off after an hour without making an impact.

‘It is normal for a player to take some months to adapt to the pace of the Premier League,’ said Pellegrini in his defence.
description: After a bright start to the season, West Ham are wobbling after two consecutive losses, and they were flattered by only losing 2-0 at Goodison Park.
